intro: Axinaea pennellii, commonly known as the pink axinaea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite and elliptical, with a smooth surface. Axinaea pennellii is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
